campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Vivid Memories is a game that we’ve been working on for a while now and we’re thrilled to finally bring this project to Kickstarter. We’ve done our best to create a game that is not only beautiful to play but provides a memorable gaming experience.

When it comes to publishing a tabletop game, manufacturing and shipping logistics are easily the biggest challenge areas. I've had several smooth campaigns, and some rough ones and learned a ton along the way! Vivid is a game that we’re ready to roll with as soon as the campaign ends.

Floodgate Games has been working with the same manufacturer for the last several game projects, and we have every confidence that they will deliver with high quality on time. As always, there's the chance of things like production issues, shipping delays, national holidays, customs hold-ups, and unpredictable weather. We're also partnering with experienced logistics partners to make sure delivery to you works out well. We’re eager to deliver a great game in a timely manner straight to you.

All of the Illustrations are complete & the graphic design work is practically done! We’re planning to start the pre-press process before the project closes to help give us a head start on getting Vivid to your tables even faster!

As always, we appreciate your support and patience, and we’re looking forward to keeping you well informed through each stage of the process until the games are in your hands!

updates.update_content:
Happy Friday Everybody!
The campaign continues to welcome new backers every day! There is no doubt Vivid Memories is a beautiful game, and we take great pride at Floodgate in creating not only games that are fun to play, but provide an overall gaming experience so you can build wonderful memories (get it?) with your friends and family!

Hi everybody!
Today we want to ask all the backers of this campaign to join us in celebrating all the amazing content creators that contributed a review, a playthrough, or a how-to-play for Vivid Memories.  We had some really incredible people sign on to help us promote the game and we hope that you've had a chance to check out their video links on the page and give their content a like and a subscribe. They all do so much to support the hobby and we're so glad they helped us promote this game.

By Co-Designer Matthew Dunstan 
Sometimes games are inspired by a mechanical or thematic idea, but in this case, Vivid was inspired by an entire category of games suddenly coming back into fashion. Brett and I were never particularly thematic designers, and neither did we really tend towards designing games with many complex mechanisms working together. We enjoyed making family-weight, streamlined experiences, which more often than not were fairly abstract. The problem with this approach is that there wasn’t much of a market for these games outside a few publishers – it was a long time since designers like Sid Sackson or Kris Burm could release amazing games that were composed purely of a few different colored counters and a game board.

Welcome to Day Three everyone!
We've hit 200% funding for Vivid Memories and are closing in on 1000 backers. Welcome to the new backers that are discovering this campaign for the first time. Thanks for being here everyone!

campaign.story:
Canvas: Reflections is an expansion to the critically acclaimed transparent card layering game, Canvas. 
In Canvas you layer transparent cards to create paintings. It is both a puzzling strategy game and a one-of-a-kind artistic experience. The expansion, Canvas: Reflections adds millions of unique combinations with its double-sided transparent cards.
Store it on your shelf or hang it on your wall!
Reversible Mirror Cards. Each card can be flipped to reverse the position of the icons. The artwork on each side has a different color scheme.
New game board. Players choose from 2 rows of Art Cards. This gives you a selection of 8 options, including a choice of 2 free Art Cards (for added flexibility when you're short on Inspiration Tokens).
Gold Bonus Ribbons. Grab a Gold Bonus Ribbon worth 3 points for lining up a specific Element next to a Gold Bonus icon.
8 New Scoring Cards for puzzling new challenges, intriguing new scoring synergies, and more replayability.
Signature Styles (Deluxe edition only). Each player begins the game with a different Signature Style. Score 2 points for each illustration of the shown type in one of your completed paintings.
Wood Tokens (Deluxe edition only). 16 screen-printed wood Ribbons with shiny metallic gold paint, plus 10 screen-printed wood Inspiration Tokens.
Ribbon Pins (Deluxe edition only). The player with the most points and the player with the best painting are awarded the Best In Show and Masterpiece ribbons.
 DELUXE EDITIONS | The Deluxe editions of Canvas and Canvas: Reflections will not be available in retail.
 EARLY DELIVERY | Get your copies of Canvas: Reflections and the 2nd print run of Canvas before they hit stores in your region. Canvas and its expansion may not be available in retail in every country.

In the previous Canvas campaign, backers came up with concepts for 3 of the Mini-Expansion cards. This time, our artist Luan brought 10 of your ideas to life onto the 10 bonus reversible Mirror Cards in Canvas: Reflections (Deluxe Edition). Thanks for all your input!
The 2nd printing of Canvas comes with ALL the stretch goals from the previous campaign. Below are all the component upgrades for Canvas: Reflections.
SHIPPING | Below is the cost to ship 1 game. $3 will be added for each additional game. Shipping will be charged in the pledge manager after the campaign ends.

*Including Iceland, Middle East, Norway, and Switzerland. Does not ship to Brazil, Russia, South Africa, or Ukraine. Central & South America may receive orders later than other regions.
VAT & UK CUSTOMS | As required by law, VAT & UK customs will be charged in the pledge manager after the campaign ends. Check the VAT Lookup Table.
CUSTOMS FRIENDLY SHIPPING | We are working to provide customs friendly shipping to every country. However, due to the scope of worldwide shipping and the constant changing of international laws, it is possible that your package is diverted through customs. If this happens, please email us at yourfriends@r2igames.com with a picture of your customs receipt and we will fully reimburse the charges via PayPal.
The Retailer Pledge level is reserved for retail stores only. Pledging at this level grants access to the pledge manager where you will receive reduced retail pricing. Your pledge will be a credit towards your total order.

campaign.env:
Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Long-lasting design
Canvas: Reflections will be printed on high quality, durable components. The sleeves that come with the game are not only essential for gameplay, they also help increase the lifespan of the cards. Canvas was designed with expansions in mind, so that Canvas: Reflections and future expansions will not require unnecessary duplicate printing of base game components.
Reusability and recyclability
Our manufacturer, PandaGM, will produce replacement components so that damaged or missing pieces can be replaced with a small shipment instead of a second copy of the game, saving gas and materials. Canvas components are stored in reusable storage bags. The box efficiently holds all game pieces and add-ons without wasted space from a plastic insert.
Sustainable materials
The box and punchboard are made from 30% recycled materials for the ideal blend of durability and sustainability. The cards are made with materials from FSC certified sources. Components are printed with eco-friendly water-based ink and varnish. Our premium components are made from wood instead of plastic. The packing cartons are 100% recycled paper pulp.
Environmentally friendly factories
PandaGM recycles all plastic and paper waste. The factory is fully air-conditioned for worker comfort and has passed ISO worker health and safety standards, is BSCI social compliance certified, and follows the OHSAS requirements for occupational health and safety. Their project management and customer service teams all work remotely, which has a major impact on their carbon footprint.

updates.update_content:
What we've been up to this month
PRE-PRODUCTION
Pre-production is moving fast! Luan finished polishing all the illustrations and I've been getting everything built and exported in InDesign. After an obnoxious amount of proofreading, we sent everything to the manufacturer. The manufacturer gave us digital proofs, which are digital files with all the images laid out in their printing templates, and we have approved and signed off on them so that they can move forward with the sample copies of the games.

THANK YOU!!!
We still can't believe it, but because of all your overwhelming support, the Canvas: Reflections campaign has become R2i Games' most funded Kickstarter campaign! Andrew and I are thankful every day for this community that allows us to do what we love most. We're so excited to share Canvas and Canvas: Reflections with you, and we can't wait to share even more creative, beautiful, and entertaining board games in the future. Thank you for supporting Canvas: Reflections. And an extra special thank you to everyone who has supported our games over the years.

Final Hours
The Canvas 2nd Printing & Expansion campaign comes to a close Tuesday, May 11 at 11:59 PM CDT.  We've been so humbled by all the support you all have shown through this campaign and we hope this momentum continues to a strong finish!
All Community Designed Cards are Complete!

Rulebook Updates 
Thanks for all your help with the rulebook. We made some improvements based on your suggestions, so check out the updated rulebook. Also, one fun little improvement we added was Scenario Goals. Each of the Scenario setups now has a point goal needed to pass the Scenario. You can play these with any player count, and I find it especially fun and challenging as a solo campaign. Can you complete them all?
Playtesters Wanted!

Seeking Rulebook Proofreaders
We think the Canvas: Reflections rulebook is pretty close to completion, but we need new sets of eyes to look it over and make sure everything is perfect. If you're interested in proofreading, check out the Reflections Rulebook and leave your feedback in the comments of this update. Note that you should be familiar with the base game rules before reading the expansion rules. We appreciate the help! 
Vote for Your Favorite Titles

Wow! Andrew and I are so honored and humbled by the amount of support you've all shown for Canvas: Reflections. Once again, thank you so much for not only making this project happen, but also for pushing it to be the best game it can possibly be.

Vote for your favorite Illustrations
Jeff and I went through ALL of the amazing illustration ideas you submitted over the past week and selected our top picks. Now it is your turn to choose your 5 favorites! Head to the poll posted on BoardGameGeek and vote for your favorite submissions. The polls will close on Friday the 23rd and the illustrations with the highest number of votes will be added to Canvas: Reflections (Deluxe)! 
Community Designed Card #2

Reminder to Submit Your Illustration Ideas
Monday is the last day to submit your illustration ideas for the 10 bonus Art Cards in Canvas: Reflections (Deluxe). We posted a thread to BoardGameGeek where you can submit your ideas. Next, backers will vote for their 5 favorites (we'll post a poll in a campaign Update), and Andrew and I will choose our 5 favorites. Finally, our illustrator Luan Huynh will bring these ideas to life!
Community Designed Card #1

FUNDED!!!
Wow! We are OVERWHELMED by your support on this campaign. The Canvas: Reflections campaign was funded in 24 minutes, and in less than 24 hours there are just about 6,000 backers! Thank you, thank you, thank you from the bottom of our hearts for making this expansion possible. Seriously we can't say it enough -- THANK YOU.

campaign.story:
Return to the world of Root with The Marauder Expansion. Raze the Woodland to the ground as the fearsome Lord of the Hundreds, or recover precious relics from this destructive conflict as the Keepers in Iron. Explore dozens of faction combinations, including many new head-to-head matchups with the hirelings and advanced setup cards. New and experienced players have never had so many ways to enjoy Root!
The Keepers in Iron are an order of itinerant warriors who have come to the Woodland to recover ancient relics. To find them, they must manage their Woodland contacts carefully, as only the local animals know how to find the relics they seek. Paragons of discipline, their warriors sport pristine armor of a quality rarely seen here, making them a terror in battle. However, to keep their forces well-supplied and mobile, they must maintain a network of caravans and waystations.
Claiming to be the true voice of the Woodland, the Lord of the Hundreds spreads distrust and division among its inhabitants, inciting torch-wielding mobs to destroy the enemies of their righteous dominion. His swarming army can overwhelm all but the toughest defense. By looting items from the undeserving and adding them to his towering hoard, his power grows as he develops an increasingly fearsome monomania.
Root's hirelings lend their services to factions willing to pay the price. Court the Marquise's infamous Forest Patrol or sway the rampaging Last Dynasty from the Eyrie to join your cause. Whether you are playing with two players or six, the hirelings are sure to offer you exciting new ways to play Root. 
Discover new corners of the world of Root.  Fight for control of the cosmopolitan Free City of Root or attempt to secure influence over the Black Market. Build buildings among the Elder Treetops or secure the Legendary Forge. Each landmark offers players new strategic challenges and tactical possibilities. Best of all, they work with each of Root's four maps!
With your support in 2019, the Underworld Kickstarter brought Root to more players than ever before. In the years since the game’s release, Root continues to enjoy a vibrant and welcoming community of old and new players alike.
At Leder Games, we are deeply grateful for this community. Because of you all, we can keep food on our tables and the lights on at the office. You also give us space to take risks and develop new games. And, perhaps best of all, your support means that we can continue exploring the world of Root!
Root: The Marauder Expansion is the next chapter in the series. The expansion offers two new factions: the Lord of the Hundreds and the Keepers in Iron. Both factions are designed to work seamlessly with all previous factions and provide players with unique gameplay challenges and the dramatic, narrative-first asymmetry that has become a hallmark of Root’s design.
The expansion also introduces the hireling system. This is a gameplay option that can be used at any player count and faction mix. Hirelings are perfect for folks wanting the experience of Root as a two-player contest or who want to inject their multiplayer games with even more combos and color from the game’s wider world.
Root is a fully asymmetric strategy board game designed by Cole Wehrle, lavishly illustrated by Kyle Ferrin, and brought to life by the team at Leder Games. Stalk the woods as one of the Vagabonds, seize the initiative with the Eyrie birds of prey, rule over your subjects as the Marquise de Cat, or command the Woodland Alliance to create a new order. In Root, the players drive the narrative, and the differences among the roles create unparalleled interaction and replayability.    
To understand how Root integrates with all of our products in this campaign, as well as our current existing expansions, please refer to our New to Root Chart.
Root is currently in-stock and available on our webstore for most regions. (For North American backers, we have a pre-order open for late Spring delivery.) If you want to obtain a copy as fast as possible, check with your Friendly Local Game Store or consider ordering from our site. For other expansions and products, you can order directly from our webstore or visit your neighborhood game seller. We will not offer an “All-In” pledge, or include previous releases as add-ons for this campaign. 
At Leder Games, we are committed to sharing our design process openly. As with campaigns in the past, we'll be releasing preview kits both as print-and-play files and mods for Tabletop Simulator. The first kit will be released on Thursday the 25th, and the second will arrive on the week following. 
Click here to download the preview kit!

If you are looking for players, you can find a huge community over on Leder Games' official Discord channel, the Woodland Warriors. 
Shipping will be charged post-campaign in Backerkit.

Customs and Duty-Free Shipping
Leder Games will pre-pay the duties and taxes for the backers who receive their games in the US, EU, Canada, and Australia. All other countries or regions may be subject to additional customs fees upon delivery.

For our UK friends: At this time the UK has not provided a mechanism that will allow this type of pre-payment for crowdfunded projects fulfilling after June 2021. We are working with our VAT agency to find a solution, but at this time there is not one available. It is likely that by the time we’re making plans for fulfillment there will not be additional VAT, but we cannot promise this with the ongoing legislation changes. We are keeping a close eye on developments, and will provide updates as we are able during the campaign and leading up to fulfillment. We assure you we wish Brexit had less effect, but alas here we are.
Countries we cannot ship to: Afghanistan, Congo, Ivory Coast, Eritrea, Guinea-Bissau, Haiti, Iran, Iraq, Liberia, Libya, Myanmar, North Korea, Somalia, Sudan,  and Syria.

At every stage of the design, development, production, and fulfillment process we have many established partners. If we raise enough funds on Kickstarter, we will make sure that you get your games. 

That said, the global pandemic has put stress on supply chains everywhere. This has caused some delays in Oath's shipping and increased our costs. It is possible that this project experiences some delays, but we have built lots of padding into our schedule. In any case, we are committed to being as transparent as possible and have a wide range of contingency plans for every circumstance.

Hello everyone,
I hope this update finds you well. We have a lot of fun stuff to share with you all. 
First, we've released our post-Kickstarter update to the hirelings! Over the past several weeks, Nick has been hard at work sharpening the hireling system. We're all really happy with how it has turned out, and to celebrate their competition, we've decided to release all 13 hirelings!

All images used in this Kickstarter are subject to change and may represent unfinished or non-final art or design. All card counts are subject to change. All card and component names are subject to change. All packaging is subject to change. Rules are subject to change.

The COVID-19 pandemic could be a factor in possible delays; in all cases, we've tried to incorporate a reasonable level of padding into shipping estimates. 

The estimated fulfillment is December 2021, but keep in mind that this is just an estimate, this year more than ever before. Also, due to the logistics of international shipping, backers in different regions of the world may receive their rewards sooner than others.

Due to increased frequency in Kickstarters failing to deliver to certain locations, Bezier Games, Inc. has decreased the amount of locations Kickstarter rewards may ship to. This is because of several reasons - the majority being issues of reward packages getting lost, stolen, being unable to clear customs. In addition to this, some countries have been removed due to heavily increased accounts of piracy. 

Bezier Games, Inc. will only be shipping to the following locations: United States of America, Puerto Rico, Canada, United Kingdom, Europe (European Union, Albania, Andorra, Armenia, Azerbaijan, Belarus, Bosnia & Herzegovina, Georgia, Iceland, Kosovo, Liechtenstein, Macao, Moldova, Monaco, Montenegro, North Macedonia, Norway, San Marino, Serbia, Switzerland, Turkey, Ukraine, Vatican City), Australia, New Zealand, China, Hong Kong, Japan, Singapore, Malaysia, South Korea, Taiwan, Philippines, and Military (APO)

Refunds of 100% of collected funds are available within the first 14 days of a campaign's end. Past that, Kickstarter still needs to collect their portion of the pledge which we do not cover. This project is being funded in USD and any refunds processed will be in USD for the exact amount received in USD, excluding any applicable fees depending on the time of the refund being processed. Bezier Games, Inc. is not responsible for changes in the rate of foreign exchange.

Harassment, name-calling, or attempts to inject inappropriate content into the public communications channels will not be tolerated. Bezier Games, Inc. reserves the right to cancel any pledge.

Other than as noted elsewhere in these terms & conditions, if any part of your order cannot be fulfilled for any reason Bezier Games, Inc. will provide you with a pro-rated refund for that portion of your order. 

If you do not log in to our Pledge Manager and confirm your pledge within 8 weeks of our notification via email to confirm your pledge, you agree that we have fulfilled our obligations to you in full for payment or donations received. If you confirm your pledge within 8 weeks of our notification via email, you agree that our responsibility to you is to ship your order as entered into our Pledge Manager system, that title and risk passes to you upon delivery to a common carrier for such shipment, and you are responsible for import duties or any other duties that may be payable to the relevant tax authorities, providing correct address information and ensuring this address is deliverable by normal methods.

campaign.story:
Darwin’s Journey is a worker placement euro game where players recall Charles Darwin’s memories of his adventure through the Galapagos islands, which contributed to the development of his theory of evolution.
With an innovative worker progression system, each worker will have to study the disciplines that are a prerequisite to perform several actions in the game, such as exploration, correspondence, and discovering specimens in order to contribute to the human knowledge of biology.
The game lasts 5 rounds, and with several short and long-term objectives, every action you take will grant victory points in different ways. The tension and strategic planning that increases over the duration of the match and the fascinating vibe that the game conveys make Darwin’s Journey one of the most ambitious projects that Thundergryph has crafted in its story as a board game publisher.
Join the Thundergryph family! Interact with us to earn Thunders and redeem them for rewards while planting trees. We are excited about this opportunity to engage more with you and we are looking forward to revealing everything we have planned for the future!
If you are part of the club, use this special code "DODO" to get 500 Thunders!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
SCHEDULING IS IMPORTANT.

Shaping the games together with our backers is one of the most interesting things of being a Kickstarter creator, but all of this additional content needs to be meticulously calculated before the campaign starts to add enough buffer time to the communicated timeline, while still being unaware of how successful a project will be.

Revising the timeline affects the delivery and affects the company's stability by postponing future releases. We commit to do our best to fulfill as previously calculated.

Unforeseen problems like the current Pandemic can happen and we commit to being transparent and thorough with our progress.

CREATING A GAME TOGETHER.

When you back one of our campaigns, you are not pre-ordering a product, you are really helping us make the game happen. This is a feeling we don’t want to lose, but we also understand that a game needs to be fulfilled at the right time.

For Darwin's Journey, we segmented the potential success of the project into four different outcomes and we have decided to establish the proper buffer based on the best-case scenario. This gives us room to listen to our community without compromising what we love the most about launching on Kickstarter: shaping a game together.

WE LEARN. WE HEAR YOU.

Starting in 2019, we decided to split our team into groups. We would be working at the same time on different projects and we would request help from freelancers if needed, without compromising our main tasks as a team.

The Matchbox collection is undergoing freight and will be delivered in February.
Spirits of the Forest: Moonlight is undergoing the initial stage of production and we are on time for our estimate of May 2021.

Today, after 8 campaigns under our belt, we are much more solid as a team, having greater confidence in facing the challenges that the future holds, and we owe all of this to you and your support towards our projects.

We will always be grateful and we will always be prepared to listen and learn from your advice.

Thank you for trusting us in this endeavor and we are sure you will be proud of the game we have created together with your unconditional love and support.

campaign.story:
Join Rainer Åhlfors and Błażej Kubacki, as they play a game of Yedo Deluxe Master Set on Friday, November 6th, 10PM CET / 2PMST.
Originally published in 2012, Yedo has earned its rightful place in the hearts and on the tables of strategy and thematic gamers around the world. With already a great game on our hands, we updated the components and added a lot of new content, including a solo and cooperative game.
PLAY

Above, you will find a pre-campaign render of the components in Yedo Deluxe Master Set. Below, an unboxing video of a production copy of the game:
These are final components - the video features an exact representation of what you will receive as part of the Geisha and Daumyo pledge. The end of the video also features add-ons which you can purchase separately.
Yedo is a thematic worker placement game, where competing clans try to become the most influential families in the 16th century capital of Japan. The core of the game is based on sets of varied missions which all clans will try to succeed at to earn money and influence. Once a set number of rounds is over, the game ends and the Clan with the most Prestige wins!
Would you like to see a tutorial and runthrough video of Yedo Deluxe Master Set being played? We've got you covered!
An in-depth explanation of the rules: Yedo Deluxe Master Set 4 player playthorugh by Heavy Cardboard. Note: this video features prototype components!
And here is a more concise video tutorial: a 40 minute tutorial for Yedo Deluxe Master Set from Jon Gets Games. Note: this video features prototype components.
Our first Yedo Deluxe Master Set stream, where we played the short game with now modules or expansions. Is this your first time with Yedo? Come see us play the entry leevel game!
--
Our second Yedo Stream, customized according to your wishes!   See the stream from Monday, November 2, 6:00PM MDT / 2:00AM CET!
Play the way you want! Yedo Deluxe Master Set allows you to create an experience best suited to your play style and the tastes of your gaming group every time you play! Here is how you can customize each game:
Would you like to dig deeper into the differences between the original version of Yedo and Yedo Deluxe Master Set? Here is a detailed breakdown of updates, changes and upgrades:
Yedo Deluxe Master Set comes with three expansions. When you want to add any of this new content to your game, you can add one, two or all three modules:
This Module grants your Disciples unique powers. Like the Ninja, who is never arrested by the Watch Patrol (he is a ninja – duh!) or the Samurai who – when committed to a Mission – will grant you more Prestige, all new Disciples you acquire during the game will come with their own special ability.
This Module grants you a third option when you perform an action with a Disciple. Instead of activating a District or a Mission card, you may select a face-up Character card from the Teahouse, to join you and grant you their special ability for your next turn. The Teahouse guests change every turn, thus creating a tableau of transient special abilities to strategically use in your game.
This module offers you unique abilities each clan can use during your struggle for supremacy in Yedo. A set of 6 cards offering new and exciting strategic options great for veterans of Yedo as well as new players looking to make each game even more interesting and dynamic.
For retailer and group offers, please message us directly!
Please note that pledges below $10 will not guarantee access to Pledge Manager after the campaign is over. Only existing pledges will allow you to enjoy the benefits of actual Yedo Deluxe Master Set backers. 
If you are a backer of the previous Yedo Deluxe Master Set you may order just the add-ons. Use the Ronin Pledge Level to gain access to the Pledge Manager.
In order to pledge for any add-ons, simply add the total amount for all extra content to your pledge: we will ask you for exact information on add-ons chosen via the Pledge Manager. With a copy of Yedo Deluxe Master Set, add-ons are shipped for free. Please see the Production and Fulfillment section below for information on shipping add-ons separately.

Looking for high-quality sleeves to protect you game? Check out Paladin Card Protection. Season 5 will be happening in December. You can order premiurm protection for your Yedo Deluxe Master Set, as well as sleeves for thousands of other games then!
During its original Kickstarter campaign, Yedo Deluxe Master Set received a total 26 unlocked Stretch Goals and daily upgrades and additions. All of these were created in close cooperation with the original designers, and provided all of the content the vision of new Yedo could ever fit. Yedo Deluxe Master Set is thus complete. Each copy pledged for during this Kickstarter will come with all Stretch Goals and upgrades unlocked during the last campaign. 
Yedo: (Un)pleasant Surprise expansion will be shipped for free to all backers at Shonin level. All these packages will be shipped from Poland. For all other pledges, the expansion will be treated as an add-on.
Yedo Deluxe Master Set is our second large deluxe box (after Snowdonia Deluxe Master Set) manufactured by the same factory which produced the iconic printed wooden components of Snowdonia. With the full knowledge of all the whole process we are able to accurately tell you both the shipping costs and the exact timeline for production and delivery.
Shipping costs will be added after the Kickstarter project is finished (except for Shonin pledge, which comes with free worldwide shipping), using a pledge manager. Before backing this campaign, please make sure that your region or country is present in the pledge level’s shipping list, as Yedo Deluxe Master Set does not ship anywhere in the world*. Content Presented

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
NSKN Games and Board & Dice – two publishers merged into one company under the Board & Dice banner in November 2018 – were brought together by a shared passion for making and playing tabletop games. Together, we have over three decades of experience in playing and making quality board games.

With twenty total successful Kickstarter projects to the New Board and Dice name, we are making use of our experiences to constantly improve our process, while decreasing any potential risks. Yedo Deluxe Master Set is a special project for us - one of great scale and scope, but also one that we have already succeeded at once. This means that we will be using all the experience and knowledge of the previous print to bring this one to our backers with no delays or problems.

We will be working with tried and true partners, whose procedures and production cycles we know intimately. Our current partnerships include fulfillment companies in the Europe, North America and Asia. With Yedo Deluxe Master Set we also have the exact knowledge of how much time each steo of the process will take, allowing us to have a very accurate assessment of when games will be delivered to backers.

However, in the unlikely event of anything going wrong, we have contingencies in place, as well as some spare time to deal with unexpected events. Still, an absolute worst case scenario may add a total of 30 to 60 days to delivery.

MISSING/DAMAGED ITEMS

We are producing, packing and shipping large quantities of games, so there is always a chance of human error or damaging some game components. In any such case, please check our customer support on www.boardanddice.com, and we will try to resolve the matter swiftly, and to your satisfaction.

updates.update_content:
Hello friends
Today’s update is very brief, and a bit different from our typical posts. Right now we’re in the middle of a major sprint to wrap up the expansions’ comic books, which were added to this campaign via stretch goals. We’ve been having so much that we felt we needed to share a quick behind-the-scenes preview of how they’re made!

After the initial design, playtesting, and iteration process for the gameplay, art for the graphic portion of the scenario comic book is drafted using a combination of reference images and a written breakdown of the action.

Greetings Citizens of Megalopolis!
It’s been a bit since our last update, and we can’t thank everyone enough for all your patience while we’re busy bringing everything together behind the scenes. While we have manufacturing and production updates on the horizon, we couldn’t wait another minute to share some previews of what our artists and developers have been working on over the past few weeks. There is a lot to share, so let's jump right in!

Hey folks!
We hope this update finds you happy and healthy in these first few weeks of spring. Today’s update is brief; we just wanted to touch base and share some of the art coming in as we polish off the expansion content!

Hello friends!
We hope the first few months of 2021 have been treating you well, including plenty of time for games amongst the crazy winter weather! We have two important things to share today, so let’s jump right in.

updates.update_userinfo: Pledge Manager is open! And other fun things :)
updates.update_content:
Greetings heroes!
Today is the day! After extensive logistical coordination, the Freedom Five Pledge Manager is finally live!

Invites

Hello friends!
We hope this update finds you all happy, healthy, and riding out the final hours of 2020 with some games! As this year comes to a close, we’re reflecting on how fortunate we are to have a community as passionate and supportive as you folks by our side. 2020 has been a long and winding road for all of us, but as the newest pieces of Freedom Five come together, we’re feeling incredibly optimistic about what the future has in store!

Hey folks!
Hope everyone is staying safe and sane as we charge headfirst into the holiday season. Today's update is on the shorter side, but we wanted to touch base to let you know how immensely thankful we are for you all! 2020 has been a crazy year all around, and we are beyond grateful to be a part of this incredible community of gamers.

Incoming art

Hello Heroes! 
Not going to lie, we’re feeling pretty emotional right now.

In the past hour or so (and truthfully the entire length of this campaign) you folks have shared some incredible, heartwarming words about this project and our team. Kickstarter campaigns are long and winding roads, that rarely go exactly as planned. Freedom Five is no exception; this campaign has been an absolute roller coaster of ups and downs, no doubt about it.

The classic game of For Sale is a quick, fun game about buying and selling real estate. It was first released in 1998, when it originally only had 20 different properties.  In 2005, a new version of the game introduced new art and 10 more properties bringing the total to 30. The game has seen massive success and has remained a BGG top 60 Family Game for the past 20 years. It is widely regarded as one of the best quick-playing filler games for 3-6 players.
How to Play
Play Through
We love local game stores and enjoy supporting them all around the world by offering the special editions of our games through our PIP program! If you are interested in carrying For Sale Autorama, For Sale: Advisors Expansion and/or Eagle-Gryphon Games in general (such as Age of Steam Deluxe, Rococo Deluxe or On Mars), please contact our Sales Director, Jason Grantz ( jgrantz@eagle-gryphon.com ) for further information on how to place your pre-order. Jason will also provide you with further information about our line-up of other great quality games and he will ensure that you stay up-to-date with all of our special promotions! Only available to Brick & Mortar retail stores. Proof of status will be required. Note: To place a retailer order, please submit your information in the following link to be contacted:
Terms & Conditions
By pledging to this project, you acknowledge that the final look, materials, and content of the rewards (and the project) are subject to change and may differ from what is presented while this Kickstarter campaign is active. All artwork is subject to change. These terms and conditions apply specifically to this project.
Refund Policy
All pledges can be refunded in full up to 14 days after the end of the Kickstarter campaign. In addition, if any part of your order cannot be delivered, then we will reimburse you the full cost of this component of your order regardless of the date.
If you apply for a refund more than 14 days after the end of the Kickstarter, we will only be able to refund 80% of your pledge. The difference is the amount of the unrecoverable fees paid to process your order through both Kickstarter and the pledge manager. NOTE: Once the games have shipped from China towards our fulfillment centers, refunds may no longer be available.

Fulfillment Estimated to Begin by SEPT, 2021
We will try to have your games in your hands before that time, but please note that this is an estimate, and there are many factors that are beyond our control -- such as virus outbreaks, holidays, customs inspections, factory quality control, inclement weather, leaky ships, and dock strikes, etc. (all of which we have experienced in the past). Please understand we have little to no control over such factors. As always, and especially in the current state of the world, things change that may affect these estimates. We assure you that you will be the first to know about any developments having to do with production and shipping as we learn them.
Put simply: you will get everything we promise to you when you pledge to one of our Kickstarter projects, and it will be delivered to you in as timely a manner as possible.
Please do not add any estimated shipping expense to your Kickstarter pledge!
Based on lots of prior experience, we have decided to collect from you the actual shipping cost for For Sale Autorama, and any add-ons you want to order, during the pledge manager period -- which will be open shortly after this campaign. We believe that this is the fairest and best approach, to both you as a Backer and to us as the publisher.
Please note that there is much more cost to us involved in shipping your game to you than just the postage from the local hub to you. Logistics and freight costs between our Chinese manufacturer and our regional fulfillment centers around the world also must be paid; as do unpacking and repacking labor and materials costs at each fulfillment center; as well as VAT, Government and Sales Taxes.  In most cases, you are only paying for the postage expense and a small amount of these other "shipping costs".  In all cases, we are subsidizing the greater costs involved in an effort to keep the overall costs to you as low as possible.
We ship your orders, en masse, to our Fulfillment Partners around the world: in Canada, Asia Pacific, EU, UK, Australia and the US. Our Fulfillment Partners will then make sure your orders are sent to you quickly and safely, regardless of where you live in the world. While we aim to have the shipments to each fulfillment partner shipped from China at roughly the same time, the speed with which each shipment reaches its regional fulfillment varies, as does the speed with which each fulfillment partner can ship out all the pledges for their region.  We will try to keep you updated as to the shipping and distribution status in your region or country, but we must ask that you remain patient and respectful during the shipping and fulfillment process.
NOTE: If the UK does not remain in the Customs Union, at the time of shipment any extra taxes and duties will be the responsibility of the UK backers.  It is possible for customs fees and/or tariffs to apply to any country outside of the country of origin for the shipment and we are not responsible for these Custom fees, special taxes, etc. It is simply not possible for us to know and anticipate these for you. This can be true for countries such as Japan and Brazil, among others.

campaign.story:
Voir la page du projet en français.
The 7th Citadel is an all-new cooperative exploration and adventure game from the creators of The 7th Continent.
In this post-apocalyptic medieval fantasy world, you play as a “slave-gardener” who escapes from the Citadel of Necrodruid Ninidazir’, only to find yourself confronted by an even greater Threat!
Explore the Collapsing Lands freely by gradually unveiling the board using numbered terrain and event cards. Interact with your environment and converse with its inhabitants.
As the scenarios unfold, your choices, for better or worse, will lead you inexorably to the epic finale against the Threat!
The 7th Citadel carries over the best aspects of The 7th Continent: huge territory to explore, hidden numbers to spot, botany, etc.
However, many changes make it a brand new game:
an original post-apocalyptic medieval fantasy universe to discover,
survival (crafting, hunting, "die & retry") is no longer the heart of the game,
customize your personal Action Deck, choosing the skills you want to make your character unique,
interact with the many inhabitants of these lands thanks to a dynamic dialogue system,
expand your influence on the Collapsing Lands by updating the world map,
return to your Citadel between scenarios...
…where you are building a city that will signal the renewal of this desolate world!
We’ll be sharing more about these new features throughout the campaign in our updates. Support us now and join our quest to restore The Collapsing Lands to their former glory!
"The 7th Citadel is an absolute sublime adventure. It takes the exploration that I enjoy so much about The 7th Continent while refining its gameplay by streamlining the mechanics in a way that’s both fresh and entertaining. Adventure gaming at its best!” Jeremy Salinas – Man VS Meeple
"If 7th Continent was the journey, then 7th Citadel is the destination. This is a great evolution of the game mechanics. Returning and new solo players are really going to enjoy the extra layers of depth!” Adam Smith – Rolling Solo
"Overall the game is very, very sharp… really compelling whenever you run into somebody to talk to. This is some of the best conversation with board game characters [NPCs] I’ve ever had!" Richard Ham – Rahdo Runs Through
For the last seventy years, the Kel Protectorate has been at war with a fearsome enemy: the Burrowers. Controlled by a mysterious individual, these elongated worms tirelessly dig underground tunnels, causing swathes of territory to sink into the bowels of the earth. 
After years of helplessness, the Protectorate finally found a defense against this scourge in the Necrodruids – men and women who rejected the sacred principles of the Druidic Order to draw upon blood and forbidden incantations. The Necrodruids used their blood rituals to create monstrous plant-creatures capable of combating the Burrowers.
In the Citadels, the Necrodruids’ power centers, YOU grow and tend to the abominations developed within, whose seeds are then spread all over the world to protect the territory against the Burrowers. Working as a slave-gardener, you wish that a fatal accident or death by exhaustion would relieve you of your endless toil.
The world has clearly changed since the days of your forefathers. The Collapsing Lands are choked in gloom and dust belched up by the Burrowers. The horrific plant-creatures that were created to protect you have spread, sometimes out of control, and are now just as much of a threat to humanity as the Burrowers.
On a cold morning bathed in pale light, you awaken for another long day of hard labor in the sacred grove, unaware that this will be your last day at the Citadel and that the course of history is about to change...

Solo or cooperative game for up to 4 players.
30 seconds to set up the game, 30 seconds to save it!
1000+ minutes of thrilling adventure per Threat.
Relive the sensation of the adventure books where you are the hero!
No die rolls: the more energy you spend, the more you increase your chances of success, but the faster you burn out!
Live a different adventure every time; there are countless surprises and the game remembers your choices!
Earn new skills, unlock bonuses, construct buildings: your decisions determine your path. Choose your destiny!
In The 7th Citadel, you face a Threat which will inevitably come down on you (unless you perish before you get there!).
Each Threat comes in the form of a booklet with several scenarios that follow one another, until the final scenario where you either win the game or succumb to the Threat.
Unlike most board games, you will experience an adventure over time, but rest assured, a simple save system allows you to pause your game at any time to resume it later.
You are a slave-gardener, captive of The 7th Citadel for several years now.
You start the game by choosing one of the available characters. Each character has an optional quest and a personal Action Deck.
Casek, female (front) and male (back) version of a playable character
Casek's personal quest
As your adventure progresses, you will choose new skills to create the character YOU want to play. Far from the usual archetypes of warrior, mage, and healer, you will have the freedom to develop your character as you choose.
Are you more into Cunning or Arcana?
Whether you want to play a teenage arcane master with a slingshot, an eloquent adventurer who can sneak through the shadows, or an elderly swordsman who summons creatures to assist him in battle, the choice is yours!
You progress in the adventure by exploring the Collapsing Lands (the game board, made up of numbered cards).
Here you undertake actions that usually result in taking numbered cards from the Adventure Deck to progress through the adventure. These are usually terrain cards or permanent events that will progressively form the game board, but also include obstacles and challenges to overcome, equipment, companions, and side quests.
The game is full of random events, always consistent with where you are, and many alternative cards to experience a different adventure every time you play.
Pay attention to the details and observe your environment carefully: it contains a lot of hidden information and numbers that will be very useful to you!
Each turn, you collectively decide which character will take the next action (search, fight, move, speak, and more) from those available to them (on the terrain card where their miniature is, their character card, an event, one of their skills, etc.).
There are more than 30 actions that you can perform!
All actions have a cost (the minimum number of cards to draw from your Action Deck), a difficulty (the number of successes you must obtain) and consequences that vary depending on whether the action succeeds or fails. 
An action is resolved in four steps: Preparation (choice of objects, companions, etc.), Draw, Result and Consequence.
Over the course of the adventure, taking actions will gradually deplete your Action Deck. When you run out of cards in the Action Deck, you must perform a Recovery to replenish it by reshuffling the cards from your Discard, but you will then lose 5 life points.
When you are almost out of life points, or when you've reached your scenario goal, it's time to return to the Citadel!
The Threat Booklet will detail the consequences of your actions, which will vary according to your choices and performance, and take you to a new scenario.
The Collapsing Lands is populated with dozens of non-player characters (NPCs). 
You will be able to converse with these NPCs using the “Book of Dialogues”, which is divided into nonlinear numbered paragraphs. You will not only choose what your character says, but also the tone they use. Then you will find out what happens by reading the indicated paragraph number.
A chapter from the Book of Dialogues
The Collapsing Lands is also a hostile world where you'll have to battle strange creatures in tactical encounters that take place over several rounds. 
These compound actions are identified by the presence of a die, whose value indicates the difficulty of the round and decreases as you gain successes. The encounter ends when the die is removed from the card, usually after you have successfully completed the last round of battle.
If you want to get out unscathed, you'll need to equip yourself with weapons, armor, and spells, and you’ll need to seek out companions. That won’t be enough to truly face down the Threat, however! You must also develop your skills and your Citadel, and that's where your Destiny comes in.
During your adventures you will gain Hope through your feats of arms and the completion of side quests.
You can spend it to acquire new skills, build buildings, send emissaries to map the Collapsing Lands, and much more. There are so many possibilities that you'll have to choose the direction YOU want to go in!
Buildings will grant you powerful effects once built such as allowing you to start each scenario with more life points, items, or companions. They will also increase the characteristics (defense, knowledge, production…) of your fellowship, in order to defeat the Threat.
You start the game with a map of the Kel Protectorate. This world map provides valuable information about places of interest – city-states, garrisons, waterways, etc. – in the world as it was before the war started. Unfortunately, things have changed a lot since then. 
You will be able to send emissaries to map the Collapsing Lands to update your world map by inserting numbered cards into the plastic sleeves provided for this purpose. You'll be able to obtain interesting effects,  and might even gain the ability to start future scenarios from a more advantageous position, closer to your target destination!
The Collapsing Lands are aptly named. Every step you take could see the ground open up like a gaping maw, eager to swallow you whole. But what if there were a hidden world below, filled with secrets and treasures just waiting to be discovered?
“On the Edge of Peril” is an exclusive expansion offered in the Collector's Edition pledge. It includes 2 dividers, 30 cards, 1 rule sheet.
It expands your adventures with new Exploration cards that will hinder your progress until you fight off the danger.
During your adventure, you may be instructed (no spoilers 😉) to slip the “Peril” divider behind the 110 card. Whenever you take a Terrain card stored after that divider (card nr. 111 and up), you must replace 1 Exploration card attached to that terrain with one showing the “Peril” (skull) icon.
Luckily, you possess a Groundquaker, a powerful artifact stolen from the Necrodruids, which will help you push the divider further back and with it the edge of peril!
We’ve been working on The 7th Citadel for over a year now.
The game’s mechanics have been heavily tested over the last few months. Dozens of players have had the opportunity to try them out, notably at the Essen 2019 and FIJ (Cannes) 2020 trade fairs. Their feedback has enabled us to come up with this almost final version of the rules.
Nevertheless, this "beta" version of the rules is likely to change slightly between now and delivery.
Download the beta version of the rules (.pdf 23 Mo)
Télécharger la version française des règles (.pdf 23 Mo)
SPOILER ALERT! Contain spoilers for the introductory scenario, "A New Beginning".
Jeremy Salinas of Man vs Meeple has played the prototype, here he gives you his opinion of the game (warning: contains many spoilers!)
Discover the game with Richard Ham (Rahdo): contains limited spoilers and he tells you when to look away before revealing the main ones.
A complete playthrough with Adam Smith from Rolling Solo: contains numerous spoilers, but you will experience the entire introductory scenario!

Founded in 2010, Serious Poulp was all about seeing the games we designed come to life.
We’re two friends that love playing and making games. Also, one of us is pretty handy with a pencil.
We’ve been working together for almost 20 years, in the digital communication agency we created in 2002, then as Serious Poulp, which we founded in 2010, when the temptation to publish games became too strong to resist.
Role-playing games and gamebooks played a significant part in both our childhoods. Bruno was 5 when “The Warlock of Firetop Mountain” was published. Ludovic was 11 and already had a few prototypes on the go (one of which would eventually become The 7th Continent!).
We've been inspired by many great works during our lives, whether from board games, role-playing games or video games. When we started out in the board gaming industry, we naturally brought all of these elements with us.
We are not only the designers of the games Serious Poulp publishes: Ludovic also creates all of the illustrations and visual elements for our games and Bruno, apart from writing cards and rulebooks, supervises production.
In 2019, we were honored by the Spiel Des Jahres (kritikerpreis) award for the cooperative party game “Just One” we designed, published by Repos Production.
Bree has worked on Kickstarter campaigns in a variety of roles, from marketing and communications support to community management, a role which she is delighted to be handling for The 7th Citadel campaign. She lives in Las Vegas, NV with her two cats, Samus and Remy. Many of her favorite games are deck-builders or abstract strategy games, but she will play just about anything.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
TRACK RECORD

The 7th Citadel is our third Kickstarter campaign. To date, we have delivered rewards to over 60,000 backers around the world.

We have accumulated experience and selected our partners (manufacturer, logistics, distribution centers) among the best in the world, so we are confident in our ability to deliver this project and ensure its follow-up (communication with the community, after-sales service) with the same professionalism that we have shown so far.

The main risk factor, which can never be excluded given the complexity of such a project and the potential number of backers, lies in a possible delay in delivery.

COMMITMENTS

Because you place your trust in us and allow us, through your support, to bring our project to life, we are keen to clarify our commitments to you.

To this end, we commit ourselves, as we have always done, to:

1. not launch a new Kickstarter campaign until we have delivered the previous one.
2. do everything possible to guarantee the sustainability of our company through sound management: control of its workforce, its operating costs and investments.
3. ensure continuity as far as possible in the event of force majeure
4. keep you informed with regular updates about the project until its delivery.

We would like to thank all our backers for the trust and support they have shown us since 2015!

REFUND POLICY

All pledges can be refunded up to the completion of the Pledge Manager, no questions asked.
If the refund is requested more than 15 days after the end of the Kickstarter campaign, 15% will be deducted from the amount (corresponding to the charges incurred by Kickstarter and Stripe, since we will not be refunded at that point), and the refund will have to be done via PayPal instead of the Credit Card you used on Kickstarter.

TERMS AND CONDITIONS

All payments (pledged on Kickstarter and/or in the pledge manager) will be made in €uros. Any costs shown in $ will be based on the exchange rate in effect during the first day of the campaign (1$ = €0.85), the levy of your pledges and the pledge manager will be entirely in €uros.

By pledging to this Kickstarter, you acknowledge that the final appearance, materials and content of the rewards (and the Kickstarter) are subject to change and may differ substantially from what is presented while the Kickstarter project is active.

You agree that our responsibility to you is to ship your order as entered into our pledge manager system, that title and risk passes to you upon delivery to a common carrier for such shipment, and that you are responsible for providing correct address information, and ensuring that this address is deliverable by normal methods. We regret that we are unable to ship to PO Boxes in most countries. If you do not reside in a shipping friendly zone , you agree that you are responsible for import duties or any other duties that may be payable to the relevant tax authorities.

If you cannot accept these conditions, we advise that you do not back this project.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Blood Money is the final chapter in the Western Legends saga that we began with you in January 2018, more than 2 years ago. Since that time, many of you have continued to support and follow us on our path through the Wild West, calling for more adventures. This led to the release of Ante Up, which introduced many new elements to Western Legends when newcomers arrived in Buzzard Gulch via train, eager to create their own legends. The frontier may have been settled, but the desire to explore the world of Western Legends still burns in many a Legend's hearts.
Discover Western Legends: Blood Money, the most recent and the final addition to the saga you love and have helped us to bring to life! Saddle up for one more adventure before riding off into the sunset!
Western Legends: Blood Money not only expands on existing content and introduces new gameplay elements of its own, but it enhances the experience in ways that have been called for by many of its most enthusiastic fans!
Adventure loving players of Western Legends can finally have the added risk they've been looking for while the more competitive players will find new ways to win in the West! Introducing new characters, items, and features that you can mix and match you’ll be able to see the Wild West through new eyes.
Blood Money brings you five new game modes, available in a digital format (PDF). Choose your favorite variant based on which strategy you prefer, or simply switch it up based on your mood. The options for replayability are endless.
Howdy partners! Welcome to the Western Legends: Blood Money special game modes! These special game modes are a collection of Western Legends variants that are meant to cultivate specific gameplay experiences for players who want to try something different. At its core, Western Legends is a sandbox gaming experience, with a world of possible play styles, strategies, and opportunities to explore, but if you've ever wanted to play a game more focused on shootouts between players, or focused on stories, or maybe who can strikeout to be the richest in the West, then these game modes are for you!
Discover more about game modes here.
 Even with your amazing support before the launch of Blood Money, we didn’t unlock the last game mode « Who Runs Border Town ». However, we decided to add this game mode as a Social Stretch Goal to unlock during the campaign! 
All Stretch Goals unlocked go into the core product of Blood Money. They do not add to each other to make a small expansion, unlike past Western Legends campaigns.

To provide more extra awesome content for Blood Money, we set up unique social stretch goals.
These Social Stretch Goals unlock when new followers are added to any of our social media platforms combined. You can follow us on Facebook, Twitter, or Instagram; it's up to you. Each follower on a social media page counts as +1 follower to reach the social stretch goals.
More details about the Backer Appreciation Pack. It contains:
A full set of poker cards from all Western Legends saga: 68 cards in total that would ensure consistent color and cut.
The full fight deck, with corrected colors on the back.
A small punch board to replace the current outlaw tokens.
A replacement piece for the general store that has the barrel icon on one side and the horseshoe icon from the playmat on the other. This allows owners of the playmat to have matching icons.
6 Player Aids (same as Ante-Up).
All in one clarified rulebook: it includes all the corrections to the Western Legends and Ante Up rules, and includes content from Blood Money.
This is a retailer pledge. Contact us through the link to discuss conditions based on your particular enquire. Proof of eligibility will be collected via a retailer survey upon completion of the campaign and will need to be submitted before receiving and finalizing your pledge manager.
The buildings shown are prototypes, final version may vary.
Optional buys not included. Add-ons can cause your fees to increase.
New to the Western Legends saga?
Follow us to enter an amazing story in the heart of the Far West.
→ Western Legends (base game): our first Kickstarter project
Learn how to play with Geek and Sundry here.
→ Ante Up: the first big box expansion, coming with a board expansion and a train!
Learn how to play with The Blue Player here.
Western Legends (base game) and Ante Up are available on our online shop:
https://kolossalgames.com/product-category/western-legends/

 Western Legends: Blood Money is the final chapter of the Western Legends saga. As such, we are dedicated to continue taking the gaming world by storm with the design, development, and component quality of the expansion to our flagship title.
Gameplay - and risk - is added to enhance your gaming experience of Western Legends. 
Base pledge includes all unlocked stretch goals thanks to your support and provide more amazing content
Discover new amazing artwork from Roland MacDonald
We designed add-ons we think will dive you straight into the Wild West experience.
Countless hours have gone into the design and development of this expansion to ensure a balanced and enjoyable experience.
The utmost thought and care were taken with regard to the theme and source material for the game. As with all of Kolossal's releases, we strive to make games that are enjoyable, approachable, and non-exclusionary.

Risks and challenges
Kolossal Games and Kickstarter: A Long Story Short


Western Legends: Blood Money is the 19th game launched by Kolossal Games on Kickstarter. As such, we are dedicated to continuing to bring unique and meaningful gaming experiences to people all around the world! 


#Successful Campaigns
Kolossal Games has continued this record by successfully funding 18 games already, such as Western Legends, Mezo, and Terrors of London. 
#Production & Delivery Kolossal Games has a proven track record of successfully funding campaigns, and we have delivered 15 campaigns since 2018! However, sometimes there are unexpected issues despite our best efforts.
In some cases, delays result from issues with the production process. We work very hard to make sure the correct components, of the promised quality, are included in all of our games. So when a component issue arises, we take action to correct it as quickly as we can. This occasionally results in us discovering a manufacturing issue very late in the process, which can delay delivery. 
One such case arose during the delivery of our game Mezo. We discovered that a punchboard was missing after all of the games had arrived at the fulfillment centers. Our response was to immediately halt the fulfillment process and begin an emergency round of production for the missing punchboards. We then had the newly produced punchboards flown to the fulfillment centers so they could be included with each copy of the game. While the delays and added expenses were unfortunate, we were determined to deliver the games to our backers with all of the promised components. 
Sometimes delays result from the development of the game itself. These may be an issue with the art, rules, or gameplay that we discover ourselves or are perhaps pointed by our backers. 
This is one of the best parts of crowdfunding because we have implemented more than one clever idea suggested by our backers. However, implementing these changes also causes small delays, but it is worth to bring the best version of the game to our backers!
Lastly, delays sometimes occur during the delivery of the games themselves. It is a long and complex process of getting games from the factory to our backers, and so many things can happen along the way! We try to plan for all eventualities, but some things simply cannot be predicted. We have faced shocking challenges that include warehouse fires and flooded containers! In the event of such an unlikely situation, we will first inform our backers and begin working to find the best solution. Fortunately, such disasters are rare, and when everything goes according to plan, fulfillment usually lasts between 1 and 4 weeks for all of the backers serviced by the same hub. Games are being packed and sent individually by hard working teams around the world, and it takes a bit of time to fulfill all of our backers! 

#Communication
For our global communication, we use many different channels, including our website, social media, and newsletter. For our Kickstarter projects, we mainly provide information through campaign updates. However, feel free to contact us through our website (kolossalgames.com) or ask questions on boardgamegeek.com.
Additionally, we are active on Facebook, Instagram, and Twitter, so look us up on those platforms as well! 
During the campaign, we regularly update backers with information on the game, campaign progression, stretch goals unlocked and stretch goals to come. We also use updates to provide answers when many backers have the same question.
Following the campaign, we provide information on the next steps: files validation, production starting, components ready, production completion, games ready to be loaded on boats, arrival at the fulfillment centers, games being packed to be sent to backers.
After backers have received their games, we remain available for comments and to answer questions. We are active in the BGG forums dedicated to our games. Additionally, our support center is always available and we will answer your tickets using the following link: http://support.kolossalgames.com/open.php.

#WIP
By pledging to this project, you acknowledge that the final look, materials and content of Western Legends: Blood Money stretch goals and add-ons, are subject to change and may differ from what is presented on the Kickstarter project page.

#Refund policy
We can totally refund you if the request is made within 14 days of the end of the campaign. After this delay:
- "No Reward" pledges will not be refunded,
